intro: Oritrephes septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its native desert environment. Oritrephes septentrionalis is often found growing in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
